title: Google\Cloud\Container\V1\NodePoolAutoscaling
name: NodePoolAutoscaling
description:
NodePoolAutoscaling contains information required by cluster autoscaler to adjust the size of the node pool to the current cluster usage.

Generated from protobuf message google.container.v1.NodePoolAutoscaling

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.enabled
params.description: Is autoscaling enabled for this node pool.

params.name: data.min_node_count
params.description: Minimum number of nodes for one location in the NodePool. Must be >= 1 and <= max_node_count.

params.name: data.max_node_count
params.description: Maximum number of nodes for one location in the NodePool. Must be >= min_node_count. There has to be enough quota to scale up the cluster.

params.name: data.autoprovisioned
params.description: Can this node pool be deleted automatically.

params.name: data.location_policy
params.description: Location policy used when scaling up a nodepool.

params.name: data.total_min_node_count
params.description: Minimum number of nodes in the node pool. Must be greater than 1 less than total_max_nodecount. The total_node_count fields are mutually exclusive with the _node_count fields.

params.name: data.total_max_node_count
params.description: Maximum number of nodes in the node pool. Must be greater than total_min_nodecount. There has to be enough quota to scale up the cluster. The total_node_count fields are mutually exclusive with the _node_count fields.
